___FooterFontSize.description: The font size (in points) of the footer

___UserPrinterList.description: A list of printers to manage. The PPD software must already exist on the target

___QueueName.description: The queue name of the printer, must not include spaces or special characters. Not shown to the user.

___Option.description: Printer Options. A dict of key to value including options normally supplied to lpadmin

___DisplayName.description: The display name shown to the user when choosing a printer.

___Model.description: The printer model usually corresponding to the PPD model name eg 2nd column of `lpinfo -m`.

___DeviceURI.description: The printer device URI, as would be passed to CUPS eg. lpd://printer.name/queue

___PPDURL.description: The path to the PPD file. Local file URLs should be prefixed with file://localhost/

___PrinterLocked.description: The printer requires an administrator password

___PayloadIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited.  Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier

___PrintFooter.description: Print a page footer including the user name and date

___DisplayName.description: The display name of the Default Printer

___DeviceURI.description: The device URI of the Default Printer

___PayloadVersion.description: The version of the whole configuration profile.

___AllowLocalPrinters.description: Allow printers that connect directly to user's computer

___PayloadType.description: The type of the payload, a reverse dns string

___PayloadOrganization.description: This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user

___RequireAdminToPrintLocally.description: Require an administrator password to print to locally connected printers

___RequireAdminToAddPrinters.description: Only administrators may modify the printer list

___FooterFontName.description: The name of the font to use for the footer eg. Courier

___ShowOnlyManagedPrinters.description: Only show printers managed by profiles

___PrintMACAddress.description: Include the MAC address of the user's computer in the footer
